cup.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: a small round container, usually with a handle, that you use to drink tea, coffee etc
cup.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: Mathew picked up the cup and sipped his coffee.
She put her cup and saucer down on the table.
Helen took the coffee cups into the kitchen.
They drank cheap wine from plastic cups.
cup.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: the liquid contained inside a cup
cup.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: Let’s go and have a cup of coffee.
Will you stay for a cup of tea?
cup.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: a unit used in the US for measuring food or liquid in cooking, equal to eight fluid ounces or 237 millilitres
cup.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: Mix the butter with one cup of powdered sugar until light and fluffy.
cup.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: the amount of liquid or food that a cup can hold
cup.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: Breakfast consisted of half a cup of milk and a dry biscuit.
cup.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: a specially shaped silver container, often with two handles, that is given as a prize in a competition, especially a sports competition
cup.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: The president of the club came to present the cup to the winners.
cup.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: a sports competition in which a cup is given as a prize
cup.translation[0].definitions[5].exampl: They’ve won the European Cup twice.
cup.translation[0].definitions[6].defini: something round and hollow that is shaped like a cup
cup.translation[0].definitions[6].exampl: The flowers’ white petals contrast handsomely with their lemon-yellow cups.
She held it in the cup of her hand.
cup.translation[0].definitions[7].defini: a hole in the ground that you have to try to hit the ball into in the game of golf
cup.translation[0].definitions[8].defini: the part of a bra that covers a woman’s breast
cup.translation[0].definitions[10].examp: He’s gone to get me some fruit cup.
cup.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: The cup was full of hot tea.
A girl was clearing away the empty cups.
All they had to drink was warm beer in plastic cups.
He picked up the coffee cups and took them into the kitchen.
Mum put a tea cup and saucer on the table.
Angie filled the cup and handed it to him.
He lifted his cup of coffee and drained it.
Do you prefer a mug or a cup and saucer?
a set of beautiful blue coffee cups
cup.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to hold something in your hands, so that your hands form part of a circle around it
cup.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: He cupped her face in his hands and kissed her.
Luke was sitting at his desk, one hand cupping his chin.
cup.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: an informal name for the FA Cup
